page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION KNEESALL
page.content: The area around Kneesall is high but level.It reaches over ninety three metres above sea level,sloping away to the northwest and southeast. The land is mostly farmland.There are two main villages in our block, Kneesall in the centre and Ompton to the west.Kneesall the larger village, has about fifty houses and two hundred people,while Ompton has only fifteen houses and forty five people. Kneesall has a school and a church called St. Bartholomew. Kneesall has a village hall,a pub,a pig farm,a dairy farm and an arable farm.The oldest house in Kneesall belongs to the Tapper family. It is four hundred years old.It is thought to be the oldest brick built building in Nottinghamshire.
